title: Best MacBook Air deals for October 2019 including 20% off discount code at Currys
text:

The razor thin, sleek lightweight design of the MacBook Air has made it one of Apple's bestselling products.

But the newest model doesn't come cheap - shoppers will end up forking out around £1,059.

However, the new Air does come with plenty of updated or new features like Touch ID, a new keyboard and up to 16GB of RAM.

The biggest selling point is the Retina display, which is four times the previous resolution, meaning the screen is infinitely sharper, brighter and more colourful than older versions.

If Apple is usually your first port of call, try checking prices at rival retailers like Amazon, Currys PC World, John Lewis and even eBay who all offer competitive prices for the latest models.

Currys is currently offering 20% off selected MacBooks using the 20OFFMAC, but the discount code is only valid until 11pm today (14 October) so you will need to move fast to get one at an extra discounted price.

Below we have listed the best prices on the latest MacBook Air models and some tips on buying a refurbished model if you're looking to save even further.

Best Macbook Air deals

(Image: Apple)

The Air first launched in the UK back in 2008 as part of Apple's mission to offer both performance and portability.

Fast-forward a decade and the latest version which launched last year following an announcement at Apple's 2018 event is better than ever.

2018 Apple MacBook Air 13.3" Retina Display, Intel Core i5, 8GB RAM, 128GB SSD

Spec: The 2018 version boasts a crisp new Retina screen and touch ID sensor (just like the iPhone) which allows you to sign in with the swipe of a fingertip and verify banking details for online purchases.

Audio quality has also been given an upgrade with double the bass of former models and speakers that are now 25 per cent louder.

2018 Apple MacBook Air 13.3" Retina Display, Intel Core i5, 8GB RAM, 256GB SSD

2017 Apple MacBook Air 13.3", Intel Core i5, 8GB RAM, 128GB

Spec: The 2017 Air is still a great machine, and with the newer model on the scene there are some decent discounts if you know where to look.

While the screen is superior on the newer model, it's still a stellar option offering an 8GB RAM, solid storage and responsive processor - all contained in a compact and super lightweight design.

How to buy a refurbished Macbook Air?

Aside from Apple's official certified refurbished outlet online, eBay is one of the most popular and reliable places to find refurbished or secondhand Macbook Airs for sale.

A refurbished smartphone, laptop or appliance is purchased every 30 seconds on eBay.co.uk, and the online marketplace has a dedicated refurbished tech shop for customers to browse all the latest deals.

Top eBay refurb seller, Ian Montgomery, Co-founder and MD of XS Items Ltd.said: “Consumers predominantly look for better value when considering purchasing refurbed tech, however environmental issues have also started to play a major role following shocking reports on waste and the damaging impact human consumption habits are doing on the environment.

“Although price is often the deciding factor for many when buying refurbed tech, it’s important to do your homework and consider product quality, warranty and accessories, to ensure you get an all-round good product.”

He shared these top tips for bargain-hunters to follow if buying any refurbished goods on the site.
description: The Apple Macbook Air is one of the most costly laptops on the market - this is how you can buy one for less
